description.narrative: Development of municipal planning and local self government in Northern Kosovo.

Insatsen utgörs av stöd till utveckling av kommunal planering och lokal förvaltning i sju kommuner i Norra Kosovo. UN-Habitat är Sidas avtalspart, och kommer i sin tur att arbeta med och genom lokala och nationella myndigheter samt ett nätverk av civilsamhällsorganisationer. Det övergripande syftet med insatsen är att stärka medverkande kommuners förmåga att i leverera samhällstjänster i enlighet med kosovarsk lagstiftning på området, genom inklusiv planering. Insatsen omfattar även två mindre fonder, en för stöd till mindre kommunala investeringar och en för stöd till civilsamhällsorganisationer för att stärka dem i dialog med myndigheter, för att utkräva ansvar och representera medborgana. Insatsen har ett tydligt miljöperspektiv och ett integrerat konfliktperspektiv.

title.narrative: One year no cost extension of agreement
Programme Cooperation Agreement UN Habitat and Sida 2017-2020
Beslut om insats Inclusive development Northern Kosovo 2017-2020

description.narrative: Throughout the last year, several acitivites to develop different kinds of spatial planning documents have been carried out in all municipalities (Municipal Development Plans, Municipal Zoning Maps, Sustainable Urban Mobility Plans). In general, the four northern Serb-dominated municipalities have been progressing more slowly than the other three. Especially Zubin Potok seems to be particularly challenging. On a positive note, two things should be highlighted: i) north and south Mitrovica have partly worked together to establish a Sustainable Urban Mobility Plan and ii) all four northern municipalities have taken decisions to develop municipal development plans based on data provided from central level. In other words acknowledging the central state in some way and the relationship between the Kosovan cadastral agency (KCA) and the four northern municipalities have been strengthened during the year. The civil society catalytic fund (CSCF), which has a strong focus on collaboration between organizations representing diverse communities, has started its second phase. The first round of projects have finished and an evaluation of the results is being carried out. The Capital Investment Facility (CIF) which has the objective to support investment projects that demonstrate the added-value of north-south and north-north inter-municipal cooperation was finally launched in January 2020. Because of the pandemic, the deadline for project proposals was pushed forward (only one month) and the pre-selection of projects was done by a panel in June 2020. Overall, the contribution is still developing slowly. A no-cost extension was approved in September 2019 and the activity period now stretches for an additional year until the last of September 2021. The slow progress is in part due to political instability at central level in Kosovo, leading to the general work pace at ministries and agencies to slow down. Additionally, reforming of MESP and transfer of responsibilities between different ministries has hampered progress to some extent. On top of this, the pandemic has led to many meetings and trainings being postponed. However, it cannot be denied that one factor for the slow progress seems to be the limited interest among the four northern municipalities to integrate into the Kosovo system.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
